intro: Phyllorkis densophylis, commonly known as the dense-leaved phyllorkis, is a species of flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its dense, narrow leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Phyllorkis densophylis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and understorey habitats.
